intro: Gymnema dissitiflorum, commonly known as the Indian nettle or gymnema, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is known for its milky sap, which contains various chemical compounds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both traditional medicine and botanical research.
